text: I started my Pediatrics residency
working on the cardiology unit which was
appropriate my heart had a giant hole in
it just after I graduated from medical
school my girlfriend of 12 years ended
our relationship we had a wedding
planned for three weeks later when I
picture my loneliness during that period
it felt like a virus I picture a
population of people who are unaffected
who are normal and there's this one
patient zero walking among them who's
the infected guy on the other hand the
hospital is a wonderful place to be
when you're in pain there are always
people there the lights are always on
there's always something to do in a
Children's Hospital you'll see bald
children who are undergoing chemotherapy
playing kickball in a hall or chasing
after a doctor and putting some kind of
sticker on his back but seeing that kind
of resilience makes it hard to feel too
sorry for yourself I am married now to a
beautiful and charming woman and I think
I have a much stronger heart than I had
it's hard to know sometimes as a doctor
when you see a family really suffering
whether it's okay to cry and now with
more experience and having been in this
situation I know
professionally that it is the right
thing to do to let people see that side
of you and let them know that you're
human it makes them feel like you're
really there taking care of them
